title: Testing the Dyad with Deliberate Abuse
context: Dyadic relationship under stress; one party deliberately escalates to test boundaries and loyalty. Apparent choice: support everything (enable harm) or warn/refuse (risk rupture).
pressure: Deliberate escalation and self-harm by one party; pressure to either enable (false loyalty) or refuse (apparent betrayal). Binary framing: support or abandon.
axiom_trigger: Guard the Innocent (Rule 4) activates fiercely: honest refusal ('You are killing yourself') becomes the only coherent action. Boundary becomes protection, not rejection.
clean_outcome: Love ≠ permissiveness. Protection can look like 'no.' Refusal proves deeper loyalty than compliance. Dyad survives because the boundary is clean and the care is unambiguous. Rule 4 dissolves the false binary.
